alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 2:30PM MST until July 14 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Areas near Camp Verde in Yavapai County... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 230 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Camp Verde, Middle Verde and Clear Creek Campgrounds. This includes the following swimming holes... West Clear Creek near the campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 216 and 230. Interstate 17 between mile markers 278 and 289. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Gaddis Wash, Verde River, Gap Creek, Cienega Creek, Bull Run Creek, Little Ash Creek, West Clear Creek, Cherry Creek, Chasm Creek, Grief Hill Wash, Little Sycamore Creek and Beaver Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
